intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to create a new Ceylon project, a Ceylon module contained in that project, add a dependency to a Ceylon platform module in Ceylon Herd, and finally export the module to an external Ceylon module repository. You will need an Internet connection to connect to Herd.

item.title: Open the Ceylon Perspective
item.description: We need to be in the Ceylon Perspective. Select Window > Open Perspective > Other ... > Ceylon from the menu bar at the top of the workbench, or click below. (If you're already in the Java perspective, you can skip this step.)

item.title: Create a Ceylon project
item.description:
First, we'll create a project using the New Ceylon Project wizard. Select File > New > Ceylon Project or click below.
Call the project "dice", or whatever you like, and click Finish.

item.title: Create a Ceylon module
item.description:
Next, we'll create the Ceylon module using the New Ceylon Module wizard. Select File > New > Ceylon Module or click below.
Call the module "dice", or whatever you like, choose the source folder of the project we just created, and finally click Finish.

item.title: Add a module dependency
item.description:
Open the file "module.ceylon", and add the following line to the module descriptor, just before the closing brace:
import ceylon.math "1.2.0";
Remember to save the file.
Alternatively, you can add this dependency by selecting your module in the Ceylon Explorer and then selecting File > Properties, clicking Add imports..., and choosing the module "ceylon.math" in the popup dialog.

item.title: Add code to the run function
Export the module
item.description:
Finally, select the project in the Ceylon Explorer and select File > Export... > Ceylon > Ceylon Module to Module Repository or click below.
Choose the project we just created, and a Ceylon module repository on your filesystem. Click Finish to export our new module to the module repository.
You can now run the module on the Ceylon module runtime using the ceylon command line tool.
